Class mazeweeper

  • java.lang.Object
    • mazeweeper
  • public class mazeweeper
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      mazeweeper()
      The Method Mazeweeper declares the start of the game It has a loop that repeats the game until someone will win or someone will lose After every direction inputted by the user, it will be put into the reveal method After revealing the direction, it will print how many mines are near It will also print the stack

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void calculateHints()
      This method calculate the Hints of the minefield It calls the method minesNear
      void drawMinefield()
      This Method prints the array of characters or the minefield
      void gameover​(int x, int y)
      If the user's input is equal to a mine, then the game will be over or you lose
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  
      int mineAt​(int x, int y)
      This method determines if there is a mine at a certain cell returns blank if there is a mine and returns 1 if there is no mine
      void minesAround​(java.lang.String direction)
      This method determines if there are mines around the inputted direction by the user If there are mines around the inputted direction, it will add up the total of mines and print the total mines
      char minesNear​(int x, int y)
      This method is used for the calculateHints method This determines where are the mines in the minefield
      void placeMines()
      The method placemines is used to place 10 random mines in the minefield
      void printStack​(java.util.Stack<java.lang.String> s)
      This method prints the stack First it calls the string inputted by the use Then it prints the stack After printing, it then pops out the pushed stack
      void reveal​(java.lang.String direction)
      The Method reveal will call the string direction which is inputted by the user It will go through a switch statement If the user's input is not equal to a mine It will be pushed to the stack If the user's input is equal to a mine The game will be over
      void winner​(int x, int y)
      If the user's input is equal to [0][7] or the end of the maze It will call the method calculateHints and drawMineField You win

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • mazeweeper

        public mazeweeper()
        The Method Mazeweeper declares the start of the game It has a loop that repeats the game until someone will win or someone will lose After every direction inputted by the user, it will be put into the reveal method After revealing the direction, it will print how many mines are near It will also print the stack

    • Method Detail

      • placeMines

        public void placeMines()
        The method placemines is used to place 10 random mines in the minefield

      • reveal

        public void reveal​(java.lang.String direction)
        The Method reveal will call the string direction which is inputted by the user It will go through a switch statement If the user's input is not equal to a mine It will be pushed to the stack If the user's input is equal to a mine The game will be over
        Parameters:
        direction - is the inputted direction

      • winner

        public void winner​(int x,
                   int y)
        If the user's input is equal to [0][7] or the end of the maze It will call the method calculateHints and drawMineField You win
        Parameters:
        x - is the row of direction
        y - is the column of direction

      • gameover

        public void gameover​(int x,
                     int y)
        If the user's input is equal to a mine, then the game will be over or you lose
        Parameters:
        x - is the row of direction
        y - is the column of direction

      • printStack

        public void printStack​(java.util.Stack<java.lang.String> s)
        This method prints the stack First it calls the string inputted by the use Then it prints the stack After printing, it then pops out the pushed stack
        Parameters:
        s - is the stack

        public void drawMinefield()
        This Method prints the array of characters or the minefield

      • calculateHints

        public void calculateHints()
        This method calculate the Hints of the minefield It calls the method minesNear

      • minesNear

        public char minesNear​(int x,
                      int y)
        This method is used for the calculateHints method This determines where are the mines in the minefield
        Parameters:
        x - is the row of direction
        y - is the column of direction
        Returns:
        returns character

      • minesAround

        public void minesAround​(java.lang.String direction)
        This method determines if there are mines around the inputted direction by the user If there are mines around the inputted direction, it will add up the total of mines and print the total mines
        Parameters:
        direction - is the inputted direction by the user

      • mineAt

        public int mineAt​(int x,
                  int y)
        This method determines if there is a mine at a certain cell returns blank if there is a mine and returns 1 if there is no mine
        Parameters:
        x - is the row of direction
        y - is the column of direction
        Returns:
        returns integer
